intro: Tylophora sublanceolata var. dickinsii, commonly known as the narrow-lanceleaf tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
